title: Obama addresses racist video shared by Trump depicting him as an ape
byline: Former US President Barack Obama has indirectly addressed a racist video posted on President Donald Trump’s social media, telling a podcast host that the “shame” and “decorum” that once guided public officials is now lost.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: Showers will occur at times in Central and Uva provinces and in Ampara, Batticaloa and Hambantota districts, today (15), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Vehicle used in Akuregoda double murder found burning in Galle
byline: The car suspected to have been used by the gunmen involved in the double homicide that took place at Akuregoda in Thalangama, has been found on an access road in the Kuttiyawatta area of Agaliya, Galle.

title: “Mutual respect, religious coexistence, and peaceful unity are eternal treasures of our country”- Opposition Leader’s Maha Shivaratri message
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa extended his greetings to Hindu devotees in Sri Lanka and around the world on the occasion of Maha Shivaratri.

title: Three killed in separate motorcycle accidents in Matara and Damana
byline: Three individuals have reportedly died in separate road accidents that occurred in the Matara and Damana areas, police stated.

title: PM Harini calls for unity, compassion and faith on Maha Shivaratri
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has extended her warmest greetings to the Hindu community of Sri Lanka and to devotees across the world on the occasion of Maha Shivaratri.

title: President urges solidarity and spiritual consciousness in Maha Shivaratri message
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, in his message to mark Maha Shivaratri, stated that with the hope that the darkness of ignorance be dispelled and the light of wisdom be kindled, the sacred festival devoutly observed by Hindus around the world falls today (15).

title: Special traffic and security plan in Colombo for T20 World Cup clash between India and Pakistan
byline: Sri Lanka Police says a comprehensive traffic and security plan has been implemented for today’s (15) 2026 T20 World Cup match between India and Pakistan, scheduled to start at 7:00 p.m. at the R. Premadasa International Cricket Stadium.

title: Suspect arrested with over 270kg of Kerala cannabis in Ragama
byline: A suspect has been arrested in the Ragama area with 271 kilograms and 835 grams of Kerala cannabis.

title: NPP lawyers condemn Akuregoda double murder, urge swift justice
byline: The lawyers of the National People’s Power (NPP) have issued a statement condemning the shooting death of a lawyer, Buddhika Mallawarachchi, and his wife in the Akuregoda, Thalangama area on 13 February 2026.

title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin urges prompt repatriation of Indian fishermen released by Sri Lankan court
byline: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has written to Minister of External Affairs S Jaishankar, requesting immediate action to ensure the return of Tamil Nadu fishermen released by a Sri Lankan court to their home state.

title: Cardinal warns of family breakdown in Sri Lanka, stresses society’s strength lies in family
byline: The Archbishop of Colombo, His Eminence Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith has expressed concern over the disintegration of family structures in the country.

title: Son of Iran’s last shah urges US military intervention in Iran
byline: Iranian opposition figure Reza Pahlavi on Saturday said U.S. military intervention in Iran could save lives and urged President Donald Trump’s administration not to spend too long negotiating with Tehran’s clerical rulers on a nuclear deal.

title: Govt must explain murders occurring in high security zones even during state of emergency – Sajith
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa has issued a special statement condemning the double homicide that took place in Akuregoda, Thalangama.

title: Six arrested in Lunugala-Bulugolla area for illegal excavation of artifacts
byline: Six individuals have been arrested in connection with illegal excavations in search of artifacts in the Lunugala and Bulugolla areas.

title: Motorcycle suspected to be linked to Kalutara shooting recovered in Bandaragama
byline: A motorcycle suspected to have been used in the shooting incident reported last night (15) in the Wadiyamankada area of Kalutara North has been recovered in the Bandaragama area.

title: Vehicular movement near Premadasa Stadium restricted from 3pm due to India-Pakistan clash
byline: Vehicular movement in the vicinity of the R. Premadasa International Stadium in Colombo will be restricted from 3pm today (16) in view of the 2026 ICC Men’s T20 World Cup encounter between India and Pakistan.

title: Several factions oppose CEB’s proposal to increase electricity tariffs
byline: Several parties have expressed opposition to the Ceylon Electricity Board’s (CEB) proposal to increase electricity tariffs by 13.56% for the second quarter of 2026.

title: Police identify four suspects in Akuregoda shooting
byline: Four suspects identified so far over the murder of a lawyer and his wife in Akuregoda on Friday (13), Police stated.

title: Large crowd gathers to pay last respects to lawyer and wife killed in Akuregoda shooting
byline: The bodies of the lawyer and his wife, who were shot dead in Thalangama, Akuregoda, have been placed at a private funeral parlour in Borella.

title: Russia killed opposition leader Alexei Navalny using dart frog toxin, UK says
byline: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was killed using a poison developed from a dart frog toxin, the UK and European allies have said.

title: Israeli airstrikes kill 9 in Gaza, including tent camp, Palestinian officials say
byline: At least nine Palestinians were killed in Israeli airstrikes in the northern and southern Gaza Strip on Sunday, Palestinian civil defence and health officials said, in what Israel’s military called a response to Hamas ceasefire violations.

title: 5,000 police officers deployed for India and Pakistan T20 World Cup clash in Colombo
byline: Around 5,000 police officers, including intelligence officers, have been deployed to ensure the safe conduct of the 2026 T20 World Cup match between India and Pakistan in Colombo.

title: Sri Lanka government approval rating increases to 65%: Survey
byline: The approval rating of the government has increased to 65% in early-February 2026, in the latest round of the Gallup style “Mood of the Nation” poll conducted by Verité Research.

title: Puttalam Line: Colombo Fort- Puttalam trains to resume tomorrow
byline: Train services up to the Puttalam Railway Station along the Puttalam railway line will resume tomorrow (16), the Department of Railways has announced.

title: Sri Lanka and Saudi Arabia explore strengthening air defence ties
byline: Senior defence officials of Sri Lanka and Saudi Arabia have discussed future cooperation in air defence and capability development.

title: Bar Association convenes special meeting following lawyer’s murder
byline: All members of the Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) gathered in Colombo today (15) to discuss the next steps in response to the murder of a lawyer and his wife in Akuregoda.

title: President Anura Kumara attends India-Pakistan World Cup game at Premadasa Stadium
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake arrived at the R Premadasa International Stadium in Colombo accompanied by high-level dignitaries to watch India-Pakistan T20 World Cup encounter.

title: Tense situation erupts at Opposition Leader’s meeting in Sooriyawewa
byline: A heated situation arose today (15) during a meeting attended by Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa in Andarawewa, Sooriyawewa, which was organized to discuss issues faced by local farmers.

title: Pakistan opt to bowl first against India in blockbuster T20 World Cup game in Colombo
byline: Pakistan have won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in the blockbuster 2026 T20 World Cup encounter at the R Premadasa International Stadium in Colombo.

title: 8,000 female-headed households identified in Vavuniya
byline: Authorities have identified approximately 8,000 female-headed households in the Vavuniya District, according to a program aimed at briefing government officials on initiatives designed to improve the economic and social conditions of these families.

title: US military preparing for potentially weeks-long Iran operations
byline: The U.S. military is preparing for the possibility of sustained, weeks-long operations against Iran if President Donald Trump orders an attack, two U.S. officials told Reuters, in what could become a far more serious conflict than previously seen between the countries.

title: No threat to national security from isolated shootings – Sarath Fonseka
byline: One or two shooting incidents do not pose a threat to national security, former Commander of the Sri Lanka Army Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka stated.

title: Bodies of lawyer and wife killed in Akuregoda shooting returned home
byline: The bodies of the lawyer and his wife, who were fatally shot by assailants in Akuregoda, have been brought back to their family home in Pitigala.

title: BASL members decide not to appear for court cases tomorrow
byline: Members of the Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) have decided not to appear before courts island-wide on behalf of any cases tomorrow (16).

title: China confirms visa-free travel for UK and Canadian nationals
byline: UK and Canadian nationals will be able to travel to mainland China for up to 30 days without a visa from 17 February.

title: T20 World Cup: India thrash Pakistan by 61 runs at RPS
byline: India completed a conformable 61-run victory over Pakistan in a Group A encounter of the 2026 T20 World Cup at the R Premadasa International Cricket Stadium in Colombo.

title: Health Minister to attend oath-taking ceremony of new Bangladesh Govt
byline: Minister of Health and Mass Media Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa is set to attend the swearing-in ceremony of Tarique Rahman as the Prime Minister of Bangladesh and the newly elected government, scheduled to be held on Tuesday (17).

title: 10-year tax concessions for strategic development projects in several sectors
byline: The government has decided to grant tax concessions of up to 10 years for investments in strategic development projects within the tourism, manufacturing and agriculture sectors.

title: T20 World Cup: India post 175/7 against Pakistan at RPS
byline: India posted 175/7 in their allotted 20 overs against Pakistan in a blockbuster 2026 T20 World Cup encounter at the R Premadasa International Stadium in Colombo.
